awd_titl_txt: U.S.-German Cooperative Research on Hadron Observables at   Finite Temperatures and Baryon Density
awd_abstract_narration: The goal of this collaboration between the PI and David Blaschke at the University of   Rostock involving senior investigators, postdoctoral fellows, and students is to study and   derive effective models for non-perturbative quantum chromodynamics at finite   temperature and baryon density.  This proposal unites the U.S. group with its expertise in   Dyson-Schwinger equations and model field theories with the German group, who are   experts in many-body techniques at finite temperature.  The collaboration produces a   group that is ideally suited to discover those observables that may provide characteristic   signatures of quark-gluon plasma formation.  The collaborative exchange visits are   designed to facilitate rapid progress through intensive periods of close interaction.  The   education and training of students and postdoctoral fellows is a significant aspect of this   proposal.
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
